result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshae Keimuel Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deshae Keimuel Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Deshae Keimuel Johnson was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Deshae Keimuel Johnson was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
*If revoked: Huber release privileges for work ONLY.
Concurrent with: With each other and to any other sentence, with credit for 3 (three) days time served.

miscConds.notes:
*Court ordered DNA sample after today's proceedings.
*Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by December 15, 2016. Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.

*No new law violations rising to probable cause.
*No drugs.
*Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

*Follow probation agent's rules.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
*Get driver's license.
*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: *As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 sanction days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed to be used at the agent's discretion.

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:

Defendant sentenced to serve 120 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to each other and to any other sentence, with credit for 3 (three) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months (1 year): If revoked: Huber release privileges for work ONLY:


AS TO BOTH COUNTS:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 10 sanction days (STRAIGHT TIME)
          in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed 
          to be used at the agent's discretion.
     *   No new law violations rising to probable cause.          
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Follow probation agent's rules.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Get driver's license.
     *   No firearms; weapons (guns).
     *   No drugs.
     *   Court ordered DNA sample after today's proceedings.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA
           surcharge) by December 15, 2016.
          Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry
          of a civil judgment.
.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
.
-20 day appeal given,

Defendant Deshae Keimuel Johnson in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

On motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Deshae Keimuel Johnson in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deshae Keimuel Johnson in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, additional time to review with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deshae Keimuel Johnson in court with attorney John P Carlson as a friend of the Court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. For reasons stated on the record as to defendant possibly retaining Attorney Carlson.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deshae Keimuel Johnson in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. Attorney John Carlson is unavailable for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deshae Keimuel Johnson in court.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.37  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/11/15 @ 1:30 pm
